Cannot use any location service. Are any enabled (like GPS) in your system settings?
This shows what buses are being viewed
Draws a line along the selected route
Turns on location when app is in use
Stops and predictions on all routes\n (no rail)
Stops and predictions on one route
There are currently no predictions for this stop
Stops and predictions that\ncross through a point on the map

Hi! This tutorial will go over the basic features of the app. If you want to go through it again, it\'s available under \'Settings\' in the menu. The menu is accessed by pressing the menu key on older devices, or by touching the button with three dots on newer devices.

This app does two main things: vehicle locations and transit predictions. This information is provided free of charge by the MBTA. Apps like this one would not be possible without their time and effort.
This button will center the map over your current location.
This field shows your current route. You may type in a new route to change your current route, or you can select it using \'Routes\' from the menu.
This button lets you to choose whether you want to see vehicle locations or transit predictions.
You can tap a vehicle or transit stop to see more information about it. By default this information is updated roughly every 15 seconds; you can adjust this in the settings if you wish.

You can mark stops as favorites by clicking the star in the upper right of the popup box. When in favorites mode you see only stops which are marked as a favorite. Note that many routes will have a stop very close to another stop, which may be confusing. These will appear as two separate icons.
You can define places by clicking \'Places\' in the menu. Places allow you to quickly jump between different parts of the map.
Please send me an email if you have any questions! bostonbusmap@gmail.com
